column2: NEW MEXICO DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 2. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: stop where you are.
column8: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 3. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 4. Drivers should adjust their rearview and side mirrors:
column4: before they get into the car.
column8: whenever they need to use them.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: One-way street
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 6. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 7. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 8. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: The traffic light will soon be red.
column10: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 9. A red flashing signal means the same as a:
column4: caution sign.
column8: red light.

column2: 10. Drivers should always be looking:
column4: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.
column8: directly in front of the car.

column2: 11. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Air bag only
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Pumping brakes.

column2: 12. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 13. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 14. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: tend to be more aggressive.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Side road ahead
column8: Merging traffic

column2: 16. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 17. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.
column8: drivers only need to stop if children are present.
column10: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.

column2: 18. This yellow sign means:
column4: Undivided highway ahead
column8: Merging traffic ahead

column2: 19. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.
column8: in an exit lane.

column2: 20. Pedestrians at intersections have the right-of-way over vehicles.
column4: true

column2: 21. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column8: No one.

column2: 22. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: in both directions may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 23. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Return gestures and shouts.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 24. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.

column2: 25. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
